sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action stores the provided attributes information by adding it as metadata for box files. The metadata can be used for correlation at a later point in time.

Inputs:

  • File ID - The ID of the file to create a metadata object to.
  • Scope - The scope of the metadata object. 'Global' and 'Enterprise' scopes are supported. The global scope contains the 'properties' template, while the enterprise scope pertains to custom templates within the enterprise.
  • Template - The key name of the template. E.g. the global scope has the properties template.
  • Metadata Attributes - Attributes of the metadata in JSON format where attributes will be provided in key-value pair. E.g. 
    {"Origin_Attachment_ID":"3456", "Record_ID":"123","Table_Name":"Files","Source":"servicenow"}
  • As User - As-User can be used by admins, co-admins to impersonate another user while executing an API request. ID of the user with which metadata to the file needs to be added.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".
  • Metadata ID - ID of the metadata added to the file. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Metadata Information - Information of the metadata added to the file in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.
  • File Metadata - ID of the new folder where all items have been moved.
    • ID.
    • Name.
    • Version.
    • Type.
    • Parent.
    • Scope.

Error Messages:

  • Metadata Object for the given file already exist.
  • File with given ID not found or associated credentials do not have permissions to access the file.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.
  • Provided 'As User' has insufficient permission to perform this action.
  • Template not found in the given scope in Box.
  • Unauthorized - 'As User' needs to complete email confirmation.
  • Unauthorized - 'As User' has been deactivated.
  • Invalid User ID for the given 'As User'.
  • Invalid value in Metadata input.Metadata should be a correctly nested resource attribute name/value pair.
  • Provided Metadata attributes has properties which are not allowed by the provided Template schema.
  • Template not found in the given scope in Box.

Additional Notes:

  • To enable 'As-User' functionality for Box applications using OAuth2 with JWT, please navigate to the Advanced Features section in the developer console and enable the "Perform actions on behalf of users" permission.
  • In order to use Enterprise template, make sure the template schema is already created in Box.

To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
This action stores the provided attributes information by adding it as metadata for box files. The metadata can be used for correlation at a later point in time.

Inputs:

  • File ID - The ID of the file to create a metadata object to.
  • Scope - The scope of the metadata object. 'Global' and 'Enterprise' scopes are supported. The global scope contains the 'properties' template, while the enterprise scope pertains to custom templates within the enterprise.
  • Template - The key name of the template. E.g. the global scope has the properties template.
  • Metadata Attributes - Attributes of the metadata in JSON format where attributes will be provided in key-value pair. E.g. 
    {"Origin_Attachment_ID":"3456", "Record_ID":"123","Table_Name":"Files","Source":"servicenow"}
  • As User - As-User can be used by admins, co-admins to impersonate another user while executing an API request. ID of the user with which metadata to the file needs to be added.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".
  • Metadata ID - ID of the metadata added to the file. Will be populated in case of success.
  • Metadata Information - Information of the metadata added to the file in JSON format. Will be populated in case of success.

Error Messages:

  • Metadata Object for the given file already exist.
  • File with given ID not found or associated credentials do not have permissions to access the file.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.
  • Provided 'As User' has insufficient permission to perform this action.
  • Template not found in the given scope in Box.
  • Unauthorized - 'As User' needs to complete email confirmation.
  • Unauthorized - 'As User' has been deactivated.
  • Invalid User ID for the given 'As User'.
  • Invalid value in Metadata input.Metadata should be a correctly nested resource attribute name/value pair.
  • Provided Metadata attributes has properties which are not allowed by the provided Template schema.
  • Template not found in the given scope in Box.

Additional Notes:

  • To enable 'As-User' functionality for Box applications using OAuth2 with JWT, please navigate to the Advanced Features section in the developer console and enable the "Perform actions on behalf of users" permission.
  • In order to use Enterprise template, make sure the template schema is already created in Box.

To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
